text: enough of me having forwarded I come
from a very poor family we just work in
the fields that's why I saw that I
couldn't help my parents there and I
decided to come here to keep helping
that I get on the legs Catalina basurto
came to the u.s. from Mexico almost
seven years ago until recently she
worked as a day laborer cleaning homes
but in less than a year she's gone from
waiting for work on a Brooklyn street
corner to owning an environmentally
friendly cleaning business with four
other Mexican women my same Tommy I'm
up I feel good because we've
achieved dreams we didn't think we could
they call it the Apple eco-friendly
cleaning cooperative before we finish
cleaning oil an apple and cinnamon so it
leaves a delicious smell Franco then one
evil if I have a 13 year old son the
hardest time for a single mother is
being without work now I don't depend on
a boss we're worker owners yes the women
in the co-operative met at a local day
laborer hiring site in Brooklyn in a
typical morning there is approximately
from 20 to 40 or 50 women from seven
o'clock in the morning waiting for
employer to come and pick them up for a
few hours of work we believe that many
of the women are undocumented and also
because of their documentation a status
many of the women are hired at the
lowest wage on a good day when they do
find work as cleaners it often leaves
them feeling sick you have to use a lot
of chemicals there when i leave work
after an hour or two i walk out and i
already feel dizzy from all the
chemicals ive absorbed in these few
hours por lo mismo kasama ha yeah since
we were already standing there and work
wasn't coming some of our friends said
why don't we form a cooperative to
improve their health and set their
business apart the women began making
their own cleaning products at home they
use natural ingredients and their
formulas often sound more like recipes
than cleansers they're doing something
not a lot of women have the courage to
do especially in their situations
shantanu maheshwari Swami was one of
their first clients
she likes the non-toxic cleansers and
the aroma they leave but she also likes
the idea of the co-operative that
they're just doing it with the sense of
pride and dignity that I think is
amazing the women have incorporated
their business as an LLC and purchased
insurance nearly a year in the
co-operative has found about 15 steady
clients and they earned twice their old
wage and unlike on the street corner
they now decide when and how they work
saying to our children I'm going to work
and at the end of the week I'll bring
back my money and not saying to them I'm
going to see if I will work let's see if
I get picked up it's so different any
hit in face the women are learning to
use computers and are tracking their
progress but the road has not been easy
they don't yet have enough work to fully
support themselves so several women
still work other cleaning jobs and
sometimes a big break falls through
after the women nearly landed a
five-thousand-dollar contract to clean
offices in Times Square the new client
canceled for us it was a big deal
imagine we are people who not long ago
were still at the hiring site and from
there imagine that you find yourself
cleaning in manhattan in the center of
Manhattan it makes you say oh my god
most of the women no longer have to wait
on the corner for work the co-operative
is recruiting new members they also have
a more ambitious plan wrestling is our
dream is to have a lot of work enough to
help everyone at the site because we
know what it's like to be there because
we spent years there in the cold and I
heat
